alert.note: Alert for New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 8:02PM EST until further notice by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...River and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern Connecticut, including the following county, New Haven. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EST. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 801 PM EST, Gauge reports from the Pomperaug River at Southbury indicated minor flooding. Flood waters should recede late this evening. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Housatonic River, Bullet Hill Brook, Hesseky Brook and Pole Bridge Brook. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southbury and Newtown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
